metadata.title: CVE-2022-21499 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - high
metadata.description:
KGDB and KDB allow read and write access to kernel memory, and thus shouldbe restricted during lockdown. An attacker with access to a serial portcould trigger the debugger so it is important that the debugger respect thelockdown mode when/if it is triggered. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 6.7(Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21499` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.19.0-15.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-kvm - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1009-aws - 5.19.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-azure - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-gcp - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-ibm - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-oracle - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi - 5.19.0-1001.3
linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.19.0-1001.3
No subscription required
